hero.title: Who is Luis Antonio Tagle? The Philippine cardinal and ‘karaoke priest’ in the running for pope
hero.description: Tagle is considered progressive and humble, but has faced some criticism for his response to the drug war and sexual abuse in the church

primary.lead: <abbr title="Ninoy Aquino International Airport">NAIA</abbr> Terminal 1 Car Crash
primary.title: NAIA car crash: The bollard that failed to protect
primary.description: Manila, Philippines — How deep should a bollard be?

secondary.title: 2 dead, 3 injured as SUV crashes into NAIA Terminal 1 departure area
secondary.description: Two individuals, including a four-year-old girl, were killed when a sports utility vehicle (SUV) crashed through the passenger entrance of the departure area at

secondary.title: More than a moment: The life and love of Malia
secondary.description: Malia's family wants people to remember her as a loving child who was well loved. They also ask: 'Please stop sharing videos of the accident. It’s painful and unfair to her memory. She was more than that moment—so much more.'

secondary.title: Notes on the beat: What went wrong with NAIA’s bollards?
secondary.description: Bollards are supposed to prevent vehicles from crashing into pedestrians, but this was not the case in the recent car crash at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport (NAIA) Terminal 1.

carousel.title: Philippines’ educational crisis: 18 million graduates ‘functionally illiterate’
carousel.description: One in five high-school graduates cannot comprehend or understand a simple story, survey shows.

carousel.title: Rodrigo Duterte is being held at The Hague. Next week he might be elected mayor of his hometown
carousel.description: In the southern Philippine city of Davao, a spirited mayoral election campaign is in full swing, with candidates and their supporters out canvassing for votes.

carousel.title: Digital voting breeds distrust among overseas Filipino workers
carousel.description: Manila, Philippines—A new online voting system aimed at boosting turnout among the Philippines' millions of overseas workers ahead of Monday's midterm elections has been marked by confusion and fears of disenfranchisement.

carousel.title: Viral standoff at Philippines’ Mt. Pinatubo exposes decades of Indigenous exclusion
carousel.description: Avid hiker Maria* and her boyfriend were among the dozens of travelers who booked a tour of the Philippines’ Mount Pinatubo for April 18. Pinatubo, an active volcano, had its last major eruption in 1991, altering the surrounding landscape and producing a scenic crater lake that has since become popular with hikers and travelers.
